body:
Meta issue to track Tor v3 support. It needs:

* [ ] Finalize [BIP155](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/blob/master/bip-0155.mediawiki):
  * [ ] Get this merged: [#907 BIP155: include changes from followup discussions](https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/907)
  * [ ] Decide how to signal for `addrv2` support - protocol version bump (as in the BIP), service bit or a new p2p message (as in the WIP implementation). Integrate that decision into the BIP (either via the above PR or separately).
  * [ ] If nothing more, flip the BIP from `Status: Draft` to `Status: Final`
* [ ] Implement BIP155
  * [x] Rebase [pull#16748 [WIP] Add support for addrv2 (BIP155)](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/16748)
  * [x] Get all unit tests to pass (pull#16748)
  * [ ] Get all functional tests to pass (if they don't) (pull#16748)
  * [ ] Address my review suggestions (pull#16748)
  * [ ] Create a new PR from above (ready for review)
  * [ ] Assess code coverage of the cumulative change
  * [ ] Write new tests to increase the coverage
  * [ ] Once BIP155 gets finalized, if necessary, adjust the signalling mechanism
  * [ ] Get merged
* [ ] Implement Tor v3 on top of that.

Related:
[issue#2091 Binding to multiple anonymous networks (esp. I2P)](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/2091)
[issue#9214 ensure ADD_ONION implementation is compatible with upstream changes, next generation onion addresses](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/9214)
[issue#18254 setting externalip=<version 3 onion address> results in error](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/18254)
title: Tor v3 support
